Love the eco-theme of the bottled water and other room items. The fish in the wall-hung bowl is fun and relaxing. Excellent food and drinks (potent). The morning coffee is high quality according to my caffeine addicted husband and I liked it, too. Best of all are the staff: can't believe that person who wrote some bad stuff on 12/9/10, we thought everyone was eager to please & attractive. Also, they have wi-fi but it works mostly in the lounge/lobby, it's a great place to start your day with a cup of that great coffee. Better housekeeping than at a Hilton we stayed at later in our trip. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Retro, funky, fun boutique!”
Reviews.Author: kgadberry_10
Reviews.Content: If you prefer something a little funky and different instead of the tired, boring chain hotel, check out The Pearl in San Diego. Trendy Bar and Restaurant with affordable and interesting menus, friendly and very helpful staff, interesting rooms with platform beds, nice amenities, great housekeepers, and more. Located in Point Loma near key SD attractions, this is a great value for people who enjoy something interesting and different. Check out the "Dive In" moves every Wednesday around the pool. Unique and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Awful-awful-AWFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Martivision
Reviews.Content: Instead of going to a more corporate choice of Rancho Bernardo Inn I booked a small group into this hotel. Swayed by the website's promise of bar, restaurant and Mid Century decor. First room - smelled like cigarette smoke although it was supposed to be a non-smoking room, second room TV would not turn on. Third room had cracked tile and noisy heater. I was so tired I let it go.. When I asked for a billing mistake be reversed I was told that I was being "rude" and had to speak to the Manager the next day to get it done correctly. I had to promise the front desk person tickets to our show to get her to do her job. Later that week while we were sitting in the small lobby the front desk person came over and told us "Lower your volume when my phone rings!" - none of us heard a "Please" and the tone was condescending. I guess someone calling in was more important than the six paying guests already there. The layout of the rooms is great, quirky very mid-century but the lack of hospitality and lack of basic professionalism by the Hotel staff makes me give this Hotel a resounding NEVER AGAIN. Too bad Eric the Chef was great and cooked and delivered meals to a room for us and gave us a free dessert since there was a private event and we were not allowed to order food or drinks at the bar - a fact that we were not told until we checked in. Not when I booked 21 room nights. Except for Eric -I would say that everyone at this hotel went out of their way to make 10 people feel unwelcomed. None of us will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “8 Nights in The Pearl...”
Reviews.Author: MarkShepherd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Pearl for 8 nights recently following a business trip. I chose this hotel, after seeing other reviews, and wanted a chilled place away from the downtown area but close enough to get there quickly when needed. The Pearl fitted the bill precisely. The hotel itself is hip, rooms are comfortable, and the food on offer is excellent, but what really makes this place is the staff, all of whom were outstanding - very friendly, helpful and always had a smile on their face. I'm already planning a return in 2011, and would recommend The Pearl to anyone that wants to feel like home, away from home.

Reviews.Title: “get your modern day Mad Men kicks at the Pearl SD!”
Reviews.Author: carlosrossi
Reviews.Content: I came down to the Pearl this past weekend and it was an amazing hotel + experience!! I must admit I am a Mid-Century aficionado and so when I was booking my hotel, I wanted something swank, and vintage. When I discovered this place I was absolutely pulled in by it's nostalgia, it's modern, and it's location! I had planned a nice dinner at the Bali Hai, which was about oh, a 2 min. cab ride, and that made it all the better! I stayed in the Gem, and it was a tad smaller than I expected however, the lavish amenities like the stand alone shower, the comfy bed, and ..ahem, mirrored ceilings, made the room all the better. The pool was gorgeous, the bar was well stocked, apparently the food is delish, and the whole staff was very nice to us. I booked my room with a employee named Erika who made my stay 10 times better than expected! I highly suggest coming to the Pearl for a nice hidden get away with someone special.

Reviews.Title: “Be Brave”
Reviews.Author: SB550
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, staying in the larger, more widely known "chain" hotels is done with every trip. It's easier plus you get the "points." Well, no longer will that happen in San Diego. A friend and I stayed at the Pearl and found the experience to be exceptional. Attention to detail, a friendly staff, and the coolest environment yet made the bigger chain hotels a thing of the past when visiting San Diego. The Pearl was a great "find." I will be back. So, be brave....try The Pearl and leave the big hotels behind. You, like I , will be glad did.

Reviews.Title: “You get a lot for your bucks”
Reviews.Author: KMKTraveller
Reviews.Content: They've made a nice job transforming an old motel into this cool, well-designed hotel, with a very attractive bar-restaurant-pool area and rooms that are clean, pretty and comfortable. Felt a bit sorry for the lonely fish in its bowl though, it seemed half-dead. The location is by a main road but noise didn't bother and it's actually very central; a stone's throw from the airport and not far from neither Downtown nor SeaWorld. Also, it's not at all expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Restyled Motel with Great Service and Fabulous Food”
Reviews.Author: JPTom
Reviews.Content: I am a convert to The Pearl as the place to stay in San Diego. It isn't the bricks-and-mortar physical premises, although it is a reasonably cleverly updated motel oozing retro chic. What will keep me coming back is the absolutely wonderful service I received from the front desk and the restaurant staff, way beyond the call of duty and very graciously offered. And also, honestly, the scrumptious food coming from the kitchen. The chef is awesome! I had been told to stay at The Pearl by a colleague who said that the rooms are just OK but the bar scene and dinners are non-pareil. He was right!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, and a fun little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rocky7474
Reviews.Content: Went here during spring break. Booked online through expedia. The flight and the hotel were a steal of a price. The Pearl was one of the most unique hotels I've stayed at. Can't really say anything too bad about it. It has a fun bar, a fun pool and fun rooms. The staff was excellent. The only downside was the cab's struggles to find it. Probably wouldn't recommend the hotel for families, but young couples and adults would enjoy it here. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: elps1990
Reviews.Content: I often visit my family in San Diego and always am looking for a place to stay, I HAVE FOUND IT! I will make this homebase whenever I visit my family Adele is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: dublin-sunman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pearl for 6 nights and it was definitely up to the standards we were expecting. Clean, quiet, very good atmosphere, nearby the airport, close to downtown... I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: 963Traveler963
Reviews.Content: Be weary of staying here. Manager over charged and offer no explanation other than â€œBecause I say soâ€� We also booked the larger room and they gave us a 112 sq ft room. Also while staying there police came and raided 2 hotel rooms and arrested the occupants of one of the rooms. Restaurant was great. Manager of the hotel was not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise !”
Reviews.Author: Italiannewbies
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned to our home in Carlsbad anxious to write this review about The Pearl Hotel. We found ourselves needing a two night getaway near downtown San Diego and came upon this hotel blocks away from Shelter Island. They gave us a generous discount because we are "locals", bringing the cost of the room down to a very affordable rate. To be honest, when we drove up, we were a bit worried about what we had decided to do. From the street (Rosecrans), this small hotel (I'm guessing built in the mid 50's) is unimpressive. But, don't let that put you off. Once you are inside the gate, you are in a different world. From the pool area to the bar and the lobby to the rooms...this is a hidden gem. The service, from check-in to dinner to happy hour, was perfect. The hotel is small, the staff are like a family. Special thank yous to Sarah, Jamie, and Vahn for their friendly and knowledgable assistance and kindness. This very nifty little hotel is perfectly priced and located for a terrific getaway to downtown San Diego and its local neighborhoods. From their Monday night 3 course Bistro menu to their Wednesday evening "Movie Night by the pool", everything we experienced was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: KACBrea
Reviews.Content: While the outside had us a little concerned at first, we didn't even question our stay once we met the staff of The Pearl. This place is wonderful if you like a fun and unique experience. The room was clean and quirky. The staff was helpful, directing us to a great little place to eat (The Red Sail, within walking distance) and continued to take care of us throughout our stay. If we had stayed another night, we would have dined at The Pearl. We enjoyed a drink at the bar and watched the food go by, which looked wonderful. The bar is quaint, full of neighborhood friends and hotel mates. It was standing room only for the dining on a Friday night. Who would have thought? We will definitely stay again. Their schedule of activities, big screen movies over the pool, and quick and easy access to everything in San Diego makes The Pearl a great find. Don't expect fancy and you will receive a great time and some new friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fake charges”
Reviews.Author: dlacey74
Reviews.Content: The Pearl Hotel is trying to charge 150% over the original rate. False claims of smoke damage that need deep cleaning, and parking charges. I don't smoke and didn't drive.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Fun”
Reviews.Author: Buckwheaten
Reviews.Content: Great Food - great retro decor, luxury vanity products and linens. Saltwater pool with movies on a big screen - party time in the bar and restaurant with amazing service by the entire staff. I miss the place already

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: SleepyG
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place! The service was excellent and the food was absolutely scrumptious. The pool is great and on a Friday night the party comes to you. Be prepared for fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “A cool place to hang with a groovy vibe”
Reviews.Author: ESbeal
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying one night at The Pearl in San Diego- a gem no doubt! The interiors were hip without too much fuss. The pool was inviting & touted plenty of toys for families with little ones or even big kids. Although, I would recommend leaving the kiddies at home. Of course, The Pearl is kid friendly but moms & dads will get more enjoyment hanging at the breezy bar that opens up to the patio and chilling with a cocktail or glass of wine from the fabulous wine list and great food and appetizers. No doubt if we lived in SD, we would be at the Dive In Movie night on Wednesdays. The room was spacious, and decorated with a cool retro vibe. The fish was a soothing homey touch and the bathroom was spacious with great amenities. Don't miss a visit to The Pearl on your next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Gem.”
Reviews.Author: bachlula
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The rooms are almost Zen like. The staff was so friendly. I would love to go back and stay on a Wed. night because they show outdoor movies by the pool and bar. The brunch is fabulous! Did I mention I love the bar? Walking distance to everywhere. Susan and Jim

Reviews.Title: “Low in Budget but High in Style”
Reviews.Author: EliasTravels
Reviews.Content: This beach strip motel proves that you don't have to blow your budget to enjoy the thoughtful design and modern touches that you might expect from a boutique-style hotel. The Pearl is the result of a no-frills low-budget beach area motel trying hard to outclass and outsmart itself with unique touches that most other hotels that pop up nearby along Rosecrans Street would never bother to think up or care to spend the money on since their single proposition is to provide basic accomodations near the beach. For example, flat screen TVs...yes, in the room - but also next to the tables by the pool...and of course, hard to miss the huge projection screen facing the pool - part of their whole "Dive in" experience, a unique touch that no other low-budget motel that I know of has thought of. Yes, the rooms are small and relatively spartan but fresh updates abound in many locations both in and out of the rooms, which help to give a nice, more modern feel to the place. What I liked the most though was the dinner experience. I sat both nights at the bar for dinner and enjoyed conversation with the people next to me at the bar as well as with the bartenders. The menu is appreciated by many locals as well, so many of the guests who eat there are not actually guests of the hotel but instead are people who simply know the restaurant as a great place to eat. One thing that would be nice would be to have a small computer area so that guests can do things like print out boarding passes. I can understand why such a computer doesn't exist though, since the space in the lobby is so small. Perhaps an alternative solution could be to provide guests with an email address at check-in in case they need to print out anything at the front desk (so they can email the document to be printed out). I should say thought that the staff is very friendly and will gladly assist in printing out anything that you need printed out on their computer. Overall, this was a great experience. If your definition of boutique is purely upscale, then this may not be the place for you. But, if you enjoy modern updates coupled with some thoughtful retro design elements in lobby/lounge area, at a no-frills, low-budget price and are willing to concede on extra amenities and space, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE GEM WITH FANTASTIC SERVICE and STAFF”
Reviews.Author: pazosa
Reviews.Content: Great, small boutique property with European-feeling flair & sophistication. Exceptional mid-century Modern design provides superb comfort balanced with suave cool. Great location close to the airport , downtown San Diego and all major thoroughfares. Incredible restaurant helmed by Chef Aaron and ably assisted by Jaime, Kat and Laura. Every meal here is a gourmet foodie delight. Amazing appetizers, cocktails and craft beers as well. Front desk staffed anchored by Marcella who provided excellent daily service without fail and convivial conversation during my early breakfasts alone. She has a consummate professional approach with a congenial attitude and ready smile --- even at 6 AM. Everyone on the staff has a committed approach to great customer service with an upbeat, warm feel that makes all the guests want to become part of "The Pearl People". Adele at the front desk is a shining example. All are ably managed by the lovely Sara, whose years of experience in the industry are clearly demonstated in this intimate luxe property. This was my second stay, and I'm already looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Re-juvenate”
Reviews.Author: aliceVistaCA
Reviews.Content: Revisit your youth. Swim in salt water pool, have drinks with friends poolside,walk to harbor, drive downtown in 5 minutes, and enjoy Sunday brunch with choices like grits, cornbread, and slab bacon and at half the cost of most SD hotels! Stay and dine at the Pearl; it really is a Jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location, a bit noisy downstairs... Would recommend it to travelers like couples or friends”
Reviews.Author: FemaleOpinion
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to San Diego. I traveled with my cousin and we arrived there on Wednesday evening, when they had a movie-near-the-pool night. It was pretty loud but the movie was almost over. We were first shown to a room, where the bed seemed tiny! Also, to get to the room we had to go through the bar area. It was evening, so there were people in the bar and we felt a bit uncomfortable to go through them. However, the girl named Adel was very friendly and accommodating. She showed us another room upstairs, which was much less noisy and had a bigger bed and more spacious. We stayed there at no additional charge. Both rooms were clean and the one downstairs even had nice mirrors on the ceiling. Also, they had beta fish in small tanks in both rooms and H2O shampoo/conditioner/lotion. Overall, one can hear some noises from the kitchen and a bar area downstairs, but it did not bother us at all. I think, I would not recommend staying there with kids. In general, we enjoyed our stay and the parking was not expensive. The rooms were clean and the staff was very nice. The location is great - close to several nice restaurants/cafes, marina, downtown, beaches. Also, the area seemed very safe to us (which was important to us, two young girls).

Reviews.Title: “An amazing 'stayaction' for my gal and I at one of San Diego's little gems.”
Reviews.Author: theman88
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to visit the other side of town for her birthday earlier this week. We rode our bikes across town from Golden Hill to a favorite spot of ours, The Pearl Hotel. The ride was great, nice weather and fun stops along the habor on the way over. We arrived at the Peal to warm greetings and relaxation at the pool with cold beverages. My gal loved the little note in the room from the hotel with the weather. We had reservations at another local restaurant for dinner but opted to stay at The Pearl instead, good choice. We sat at the bar with a nice gal (can't remembe her name, short black hair) and had a great meal. I mentioned to my girlfriend that it was nice to find items like foie gras and steak tartar on the menu, the cocktails went great with dinner too. Nice finish with donut dessert and desset wines. Overall a recommendable experience at The Pearl, great job!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Hidden Secret”
Reviews.Author: MsAustralia
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at The Pearl ! The facilities and staff customer service exceeded my expectations. They have done a great remodel of this hotel, however the entrance is quite confusing, the reception is kind of hidden to the left and you feel as if you are checking into a restaurant not a hotel. With that said, they have certainly got everything else right. The menu and bar prices are on point, the food is exceptional and ambience is indicative of a very 'beachy' San Diego culture. The location, gives you the option of staying close to downtown and the airport with a more boutique hotel experience rather than your stock standard hotel room. My hotel room was well appointed, with a very comfortable bed. There were little touches throughout the room that made me smile, especially 'Ginger' the goldfish who was to be my room mate. Will definitely check into 'The Pearl' again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place--can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: lissab82
Reviews.Content: Hip retro style, friendly service, welcome email a day in advance. Great pool area and dining. Each room comes with its own beta fish-fun! My partner bought me the art on the wall which supports giving at risk kids opportunities in expressive arts (only 25 bucks!). My only gripe is that the bar closes at 11:00--a little early but it IS a hotel where folks are trying to sleep. It is also a little noisy, but its noisy everywhere in southern CA. Room held up during a medium sized earthquake on the second day of the stay :) Overall, great value.

Reviews.Title: “EI liked this hotel despite our bad experience, the staff were lovely, the pool area is cool and modern especially at ni”
Reviews.Author: petefryatt
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel despite our bad experience, the staff were lovely, the pool area is cool and modern especially at night, the decor is fun and the food was great. The customer service was excellent and they made us feel so very welcome chatting to us for hours (bless 'em), price-wise it was pretty good and the location while not so pretty is certainly convenient - we really enjoyed our stay here however a couple of incidents greatly marred our stay here: This hotel likes to host events, the afternoon of arrival was a pool party, the second evening was a skater party and evening three was a surf club party. The layout of the hotel is such that you enter into the reception/bar area that opens out on to the pool. The events take place in the bar / pool area. The staff made it clear that guests were welcome to all, and we didn't feel too awkward hanging out in the bar area however: 1) Ourselves and another two individual guests we befriended were unable to take a nap in the afternoons due to the noise of the events - particularly the skater party whereby the attendees congregated outside our rooms chatting and shrieking loudly. 2) The skater party was filled with underage drinkers, people smoking pot and the path to our room was completely blocked by the large group of teenagers outside our door. We were on the first floor so the path is an outdoor balcony that overlooks the pool. We were eventually compelled to leave the hotel to eat out and returned later to find the police had been called to break up the party. Anybody in their right mind could have predicted this outcome. Apparently the police were called for the pool party the day before also, but we didn't see this. While we did receive an email from the management apologising for the disturbance, we weren't offered so much as a free drink as compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Chic”
Reviews.Author: Over_packed_10
Reviews.Content: We loved the fun, mod design of the hotel and the price was excellent. It was a short trip, but the staff was friendly and the atmosphere was great. Clean, modern interier with great features like the bar/restaurant and movie projected above the pool. This is a great stay for a young, fun traveler because there's noise at night and lots of visitors that are not staying at the hotel. We had one issue with the noise, but after we called, the staff promptly took care of it. Overall, great stay, would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Magical...”
Reviews.Author: HorizonPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: Who would have thought a place like this existed in Point Loma?! The Pearl Hotel and its chic mid-century/modern restaurant and lounge are very unique and the food, "Oh so tasty." The rooms are not large, but very comfortable and serve their purpose for a good night's sleep with all the necessary amenities including H20 products. The beds: I actually slept through my alarm because the bed was so comfy, bad deal for me (workwise), but a plus for the hotel. The rooms sort of horseshoe around the pool and the big screen over the pool is cool to watch movies and lounge. I came down from Palm Springs for work, but will surely return soon for a weekend getaway. Can't beat the value and it is close to downtown too!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, cool but still a motel.”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I came up from Orange County for a 3-day conference. No complaints really. This is a very stylish and chic motel makeover. The room was a little dingy (i.e, it still had the motel smell/feel even after a very solid makover). The restaurant was fantastic! I'd say the best in SD; seriously. The pool area is also very cool and very stylish. If you're looking for a perfect little getaway in San Diego, this is definitely the place. The Pearl has character and outdoes the cold, mega hotels of SD very nicely. Good work to those who made it into what it is today!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky - nice refreshing change”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at The Pearl hotel in San Diego. What a fun, funky refreshing change from 'bland' hotels! This is a very small property but extremely well done. They have taken an older hotel and transformed it into a hip, fun spot. I was there on a Wednesday night and it was hopping. Wednesday is movie night - they project a movie on a large screen hanging from the balcony, poolside, where guests can sit at the bar, sit near the pool, or even float in the pool and enjoy the movie. The rooms are very comfortable, and even come with your own pet fish in a fishbowl! Great concept, and very well done. I found a great online rate. Will return when business brings me back to SD.

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in San Diego, or anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: rachelherman92106
Reviews.Content: I not only stayed at The Pearl, I threw my husband's 40th Surprise Party there! Tons of friends gathered there for a swanky dinner--the meal was fantastic--and spent the evening in bliss drinking cocktails in the inner courtyard around the lit pool. The staff was so helpful in organizing the event, and even more gracious that night. We stayed at The Pearl and woke up late, drank really great coffee then rode bikes (The Pearl's !) off to explore. We've been back many times. Dinner and movie nights by the pool are a hoot. Great wine list and the cheese course represents the best in CA. Love the vibe here, the artwork, the shag rug in the game/reading lounge. Point Loma is a great destination and The Pearl is really a gem in a dynamite city.

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mshesspettersson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Pearl Hotel in San Diego to celebrate his birthady. We arrivied to a friendly, young staff who knew us by name and had included a handwritten birthday note and complimentary cocktail upon arrival. The rest of the weekend was followed by warm hospitality,amazing cocktails, and delicious food, all while surrounded by a hip mid-century vibe. Can't wait to go back and spend some more time enjoying the pool and "botomless mimosas" at brunch!

Reviews.Title: “NYC chic at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: pinkfloyd79
Reviews.Content: We atyed at the Pearl as a getaway in our own city, the atmosphere is fun and funky. The rooms are hip, modern, and clean. It felt like a NYC boutique hotel near the ocean. The restaurant is great and the crowd is fun. We will def be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is hands down the best place to...”
Reviews.Author: Jock_Stewart
Reviews.Content: The Pearl is hands down the best place to stay, eat and drink in SD. The rooms have style, the food is awesome and the staff is cool. Just stay there. DS San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel and staff are awesome at The Pearl”
Reviews.Author: PositiveP
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the The Peal Hotel. It was fun, funky, comfortable and ultra groovy. Brianna, Thomas, Devon and the rest of the staff were awesome. My roommate Greta the fish was quiet when I slept and a great conversationalist during the day I called my brother and he loves the "tiki bar" atmosphere and he is going to book a room next month. I stayed in THE GEM and it was wonderfully cozy. When I will return with my gal I will book a The Strand or the Jewel because they are bigger rooms. The bar atmoshphere is trendy and fun. I arrived at 5:00 pm and had a drink with a friend and an awesome party happened around us. The bar staff was great and really enjoying their jobs which made for an awesome experience. The pearl pool area is fun and well kept. I was surprised how quiet my room was even though I was poolside. I slept very well. Their is a great path to run on 2 minutes from the hotel on the ocean which makes for a great view. It was relaxing and wonderful to wake up in the morning and have a relaxing coffee next to the pool while I checked my internet. I could not say enough good things about the hotel and the staff so make sure you book a night or two at The Pearl when you go to SD!

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl - Boutique Central”
Reviews.Author: doretti1
Reviews.Content: The Pearl oozes small scale coolness like the Avalon, the Clarendon or Valley Ho and was evident by the amount of the people in the hotel bar/lounge area that were NOT guests of the hotel (my impression). I checked in at 11:00 pm at night and the place was bumpin'. It's definitely not for the a-typical business traveller who loves the monotony of a courtyard or hampton inn. Room was farthest away from the lobby but the voices carried. I cranked my AC Unit so it wasn't so bad. Room wasn't it bad shape but the bathroom was slightly suspect with random and patched grout lines as well as chips in the tub. Parking can be a bear. Fortunately, there was one spot up front with a cone in front. I asked the attendant if I could park there and she said yes so I was fortunate. Based on other reviews, the parking seems to be the nemesis. Overall, it's definitely for the younger urban-ites who like vibe and a sense of trend.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in my own back yard.”
Reviews.Author: 619CaliGirl
Reviews.Content: Although I live in beautiful San Diego, I still need to get away sometimes. This is when I throw a few things into a bag and drive 20 minutes to The Pearl. The entire facility is gorgeous and as soon as you walk through the doors you are in a whole other world, one filled with zen, peace, relaxation and class. Their credo "Down to Earth, Up with Style" could not be any more perfect. I also held a special event there and could not have asked for a better location, service or hospitality. Their dedication to community and retaining a classy, casual atmosphere is beyond what mere words could express.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Fun”
Reviews.Author: fabergeeeee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at the Pearl while celebrating my birthday in May. The staff was wonderful, very helpful and accommodating they even upgraded us to thier suite for my birthday! Unfortunately we arived too late for the restaurant, have to save that for next time, but we did hit up the swanky little bar for some great drinks! We'll be back to try out the restaurant, movie night and the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky motel. Terrific staff.”
Reviews.Author: kekahi808
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I were in town for 4 nights. We had stayed at the Kona Kai on Shelter Island before but wanted to try something different. The Pearl is a really hip little boutique motel, and the owners have done a good job with the renovation. But the motel is what it is - an old facility that's been dressed up. The toilet ran so you had to open the tank to fix it, the tub faucet leaked, and the motel is right on the the boulevard so you get street noise if you open your windows. We used the A/C on Saturday night because of the bar/restaurant activity, and that racket was better than the street and bar noise level, but it was still a racket. The room was clean, linens were comfy, WIFI was easy, and parking worked out. Every employee we met was very pleasant and professional. Would I stay there again? For me, I would prefer something like the Kona Kai because of the location and calmer street traffic. But I would definitely recommend the place to friends. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “THE HIGHEST QUALITY AT THE LOWEST PRICE”
Reviews.Author: ECONNOISSEUR
Reviews.Content: Unique and one-of-a-kind, the hotel is special because, by definition, rare = precious (the "Pearl" is aptly named); you get so much for so little (I define "cool" as being able to make a nickel look like a quarter, and the Pearl makes you feel like an "econnoisseur" staying here); you're made to feel welcome, but more importantly made to feel like you're at home, and that sense of welcome is inclusive ("come as you are") rather than exclusive ("are you the 'right' kind of people?").

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDee16
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just visited The Pearl Hotel for his birthday weekend on April 16. I chose this place based on the excellent price, amenities, location, and positive reviews / pictures that were noted here. Our experience was top notch from start to finish. We purchased a package that included the cost of parking at the hotel. I highly recommend this as the hotel parking spots are limited and street parking can be challenging at times. The package also included two cocktails and an appetizer each day we were there. We had no idea how fantastic the food was going to be and when we did, we totally took advantage of those coupons. We ate dinner twice at the restaurant and had Sunday brunch. The food choices went beyond the ordinary (brushetta with squash...who knew?), the service was fantastic (Vanessa our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive), and the food quality was outrageous. We loved the restaurant so much we decided not to go out the 2nd night and dine in again after eating at the hotel the night before. The meals were affordable especially since we ended up getting an entree for free each night for a birthday special and because we used a coupon they have online. You can dine by the pool or inside, but regardless it is an open air restaurant with a great atmosphere which includes groovy tunes and a movie running at the Dive-In Theatre (soundless of course as the music sets the mood). We liked our room as it was clean, well decorated (60s retro), had quality electronics, and most importantly the bed was comfortable. The pet fish was also a great touch! The room was just big enough as we tend to be out more than we stay in. The pool is really a nice to have and I especially enjoyed cat naps in the hammock swings that are right next to it. The hotel was close in proximity to just about everything making it so easy and quick to get around: La Jolla, Sea World, Mission Bay, downtown, Balboa Park, Little Italy, etc... The staff went out of their way to help us get acclimated to the area and settled comfortably at the hotel. John even moved a table from inside to out by the pool for dinner when we asked for an outside seat and there weren't any left. Now that is what I call Service! Ironically we also ran into our waitress Vanessa at a local restaurant she had recommended where she greeted us with hugs and excitement! Overall this staff made us feel at home and even went beyond that by giving us VIP treatment without the VIP cost. Overall I would say this hotel is better for adults as the atmosphere lends to it. It is also a hot spot on the weekends so if a lively nightlife is not what you are looking for then this is not the place for you. We cannot wait to go back to The Pearl Hotel and are figuring out when that will be.....

Reviews.Title: “Extremely excited to come back and visit!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewBuoscio
Reviews.Content: I am a stay at home dad with three kids, and my wife booked me a room for my birthday and a little r&r. I stayed in the Gem, which was small, but perfect for myself. The deco was awesome, and I had no problem checking in a half hour early to make an appointment I had. I loved the beds; It was so comfy and the sheets were better than average. The bathroom was also small, but perfect for just me. The H20+ products were awesome. I ate at the restaurant both nights and enjoyed it immensely. My wife and I are both chefs and are pretty particular in our food. I especially enjoyed the beers they have on tap. Since I came solo, I brought my bike with so getting around was easy for me; It is located close to everything. All in all, I am looking forward to returning again. I would not recommend bringing a family to the Pearl, but 1 or 2 people is perfect for sightseeing, romantic, or relaxing. Thanks again Pearl!

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: hjc_Denver
Reviews.Content: I LOVED The Pearl! It was very cool and trendy without being pretentious. We stayed in a Strand room. It was very large and had a small balcony overlooking the pool and restaurant. My favorite part was our fish (Bruce Lee) that lived in the room. The restaurant had wonderful food and a great relaxed vibe. We arrived about 15 minutes before dinner hours ended on Friday night, but everyone was very polite and we never felt rushed. I was worried about parking since the lot is so small and usually full, but it was very easy to find street parking in the neighborhood. We never had to walk more than three blocks and felt very safe. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a fun and unique place to stay. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Cool Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Ever_Travel
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute business trip to San Diego and choose The Pearl. It had a great vibe at the restaurant/bar at a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Laid-Back California Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: AmandaTheGreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights for a wedding and LOVED The Pearl. I wouldn't necessarily say it was family friendly, because the nights we were there, there were masses of people poolside and at the bar and loud music until about 11 P.M. We didn't mind at all, but the older members of our group weren't thrilled. Their website doesn't do it justice. The beachy theme, fish in your room, and comfy bed makes for a fun stay.

Reviews.Title: “Doesnt seem like a safe area”
Reviews.Author: cara_jay_4
Reviews.Content: The rooms are alright. TV channel options are good though. It is a old motel that has tried to be rennovated, but still not nice. Room was still alright. What put me and my partner off is the nieghbourhood. Would not reccomend walking down the streets at night. Barely any parking eventhough they charge you for it and mind you it is off street parking!! Would not recommend it, mostly due to the area, but also looks alot better than what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Mixing Business with Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: CEnriquez
Reviews.Content: Last minute I had Real Estate business to do down in San Diego and needed a place to stay for 4 nights. I'm not too familiar with San Diego, so my assistant booked 4 nights at the Pearl hotel in Point Loma. By the way, what a great value for a super cool mid century modern designed room in a very energetic boutique hotel. From the moment I checked in I felt welcomed by the front desk girl, Brianna. The room was not big but was laid out well and had all of the necessary amenities. Over the course of the next 4 days I had the pleasure of meeting all 3 of the front desk girls, Brianna, Devon and Julia who were all very helpful and friendly. An escape from staying in the hustle and bustle of being Downtown or in the Gaslamp District, but only a 10 min. easy drive. Following a long stressful day of meetings, the lively restaurant and bar scene was just what the Dr. ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Comfortable and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: West_LA_GIRL68
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Pearl Hotel in early March. Check in was easy and friendly. Location was not as close to Downtown as I would have liked but that was my own fault. The hotel itself was adorable. The rooms were basic and clean. It did not have a mini-fridge which was a drag but we bought a cooler from the local market. The lounge was HAPPENING every nigth we were there and it was a nice set up. I would stay there again and I would recommend The Pearl to my friends. It was a great value and a fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for business...”
Reviews.Author: frost05
Reviews.Content: You'll never get to sleep. The only advantage of the continuously loud, throbbing dance music is that it drowns out the traffic noise from the street. I, too, was suckered by the glowing reviews, but in reality, this is a refurbished motel that has cleverly marketed itself as a hip destination spot. It's located in a nondescript area of town, and the furnishings are Ikea-quality generic modern. The pool is small and filled with plastic balls, making it all but unusable. The attraction of this place seems to be the bar, which unfortunately is in an open courtyard, which means you get to hear the music all night, whether you want to or not. The crowd is young, as is the staff. If you are, too, and are on vacation, you might like this place. But don't stay here for business.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: hdubdallas
Reviews.Content: We came into San Diego with no agenda or idea where to stay. My friend, who is from San Diego suggested the Pearl. We were in the parking lot of the San Diego Zoo and figured we needed a place to stay. We called the Pearl and they had an open room for the next too nights for a fantastic rate. When we got there we were so impressed. It looked amazing. The bar and lounge area had a 70's vibe, with shag carpet and board games. Everyone who worked there were extremely nice and answered all of our questions. When we got to our room we laughed because it was so unexpected and cool. A nice platform bed, again, shag carpet, a live beta fish in a bowl on the wall. I could go on and on. Oh and the pool area was awesome! All around the pool were all kinds of chairs and areas to sit and have drinks. There was also a huge screen above the pool, which we found out later that they show movies on at night. The restaurant was crazy, good. The food is to die for! I would recommend this place to anyone who is wants to have a good time in San Diego. It is 15 mins from just about anywhere you want to go in SD. During the summer their rates get a little expensive, so I would suggest trying them out in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “a cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodealooking
Reviews.Content: Clean and cute, room is a little bit small. Difficult to park, charge $10 per night if park in hotel's lot.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: plasticintruder
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a meeting and would normally book the Hampton or Sheraton up the road but found a good deal on Expedia and liked the retro-style of the Pearl San Diego. The hotel is well located near major attractions and a short distance to downtown and other areas. The rooms are updated and have a 'mid-century modern' style that reflects the building's era. The bathrooms are bright and clean, and have updated fixtures and great H2O spa products The on-site bar and restaurant host a variety of events and movies are often shown drive-in style in the pool area. Parking is very reasonable compared to nearby properties, and wifi is free. All this made for a much more memorable stay than large, chain properties. I would recommend this hotel and would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenniesarina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night before flying back home. It was a very affordable and the room was big and trendy. The bed was very comfortable and parking was only 10 dollars. The staff was very service minded. The only minus is that it is not in the city centre, but it is very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Steal of a deal”
Reviews.Author: tr4v3l_g1rl
Reviews.Content: Overview- the retro-modern style was fun and we wished we could have stayed a bit longer. Service- both conceierges we encountered were very helpful and gave great tips on local coffee shops and transportation. Room- the rooms are minimal, but that's part of the appeal to me. It was clean, had a comfortable king bed, and a nice TV. Location- between the airport ($9 cab ride +tip) and Ocean Beach ($2.25, 20 minute bus ride) on Point Loma. If you're looking for downtown/Gaslamp action, you'll have to plan. If you have a car, there's barely any parking downtown and it's expensive. If you don't have a car, the main bus only runs every half hour and not past 7PM. We ended up bussing into town and cabbing it back ($20 +tip). Restaurant- I highly reccommend staying in one night (Wednesday night is movie night by the pool!) and enjoying dinner and drinks at the restaurant. It's really one of the best parts of The Pearl. The server/bartenders were top-notch and there were quite a few locals who stopped by, always a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “Great mattresses - good location: a great stay if you're not on low budget”
Reviews.Author: hmv89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Pearl Hotel in San Diego for 3 nights in total in January 2010. The 3rd night was spontaneous and due to the season it was not a problem to ask for a room a day before. The service was great. In the first room (standard) the faucet of the shower was dripping but they fixed it properly as soon as we told them. The rooms were clean and nicely furnished (modern style) and the beds were large and very comfortable. The hotel has a pool and a bar which is probably very nice in summer time but we didn't take advantage of them. The Pearl might not be a good place for people who are sensitive to noise. The adjacent road (Rosecrans Street) is a very frequented street and the hotel opens onto the road. So there are more quiet rooms and less quiet rooms. However we did not have a problem with the noise, nor with the bar having loud music till rather late one night. The water and the harbor are very close by car and there's a place Point Loma CafÃ© that can be recommended for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Overall the Pearl was a decent stay for its price, although the parking fee might be reduced by about 2$ (currently 10$ a night). Also we personally didn't like the fish in the room. A small bowl at the wall, empty except for one lonely fish. I am sure they are feed properly but lonely like that, no plants, nothing, that's not a life. Other than that believe the good reviews and stay at the Pearl :)

Reviews.Title: “Business travel with a little added quirk and fun”
Reviews.Author: Firefly1979
Reviews.Content: I spend about 5 months out of the year traveling for my job, and I look forward to working in San Diego... Not just because of the sun, but because of The Pearl. I've stayed at the Pearl about 4 times over the last 2 years, and I love having a desk for easy computer set-up, the mid-century modern style and VERY comfortable beds. The Pearl is a great balance of clean design,quirkiness (there are beta fish in every room with cute names, and old school surfing films playing out by the pool) as well as great service and fantastic food. I enjoy rolling into the Pearl after a long day and having a glass of wine at the bar and chatting with the fantastic and down to earth staff, working in my room or napping for an hour or two, and then heading back down for dinner and films... I honestly don't venture out unless I'm meeting up with friends. I would encourage business travelers to give the Pearl a shot in lieu of your normal Holiday In or Hampton Inn. It's around the same price or lower!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: the_waters
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in San Diego but regularly stay out at hotels just to 'get away'. We've stayed at many places in the city and the surrounding area, but none with the flavor of The Pearl Hotel. Everything about this place is inviting. It's clean, the staff are very friendly, the rooms are comfortable and have great design... and there are many details that make The Pearl Hotel really stand out. We'll definitely be staying again and recommending it to all our friends. Stay at the Pearl... you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is a great boutique hotel with a little personality”
Reviews.Author: LinzeeK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to San Diego for a quick overnight stay and decided to just go for a cheap option since we wouldn't be spending much time in the hotel. I saw that The Pearl got great reviews and that it was incredibly inexpensive (I think we paid $69 for the night!). I wasn't expecting much, but it was a great little hotel! It looks like it's basically a renovated motel from the 50's - a bunch of rooms surrounding a pool in the courtyard. They've done such a good job of fixing it up and making it comfortable and very unique. I would recommend going up one level from the basic room because you'll get a much nicer, upgraded bathroom. But you really can't go wrong with any of them. One thing not to be missed is the restaurant. It was one of the best meals ever! They have different theme nights during the week, so just be sure to see if they have the full menu, but everything we had was amazing. The location isn't RIGHT by anything we really wanted to see, but it's a quick drive (under 10 minutes) to downtown or the beaches (PB, OB, Mission Beach, etc.) I would highly recommend this place to anyone who likes a hotel with more personality than the big chains.

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is an intimate boutique hotel... a chill vibe for everyone one to enjoy and relax!”
Reviews.Author: tdominice
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Pearl was relaxing....dinner and drinks in the bar/resurant...while the kids enjoyed the shag carpet lounge...fries..soda and games...to play... Something for everyone to enjoy.... The rooms are tranquil ......I especially enjoyed having a fish in the room to complete the Zen feeling. I can't wait to return... Bliss....

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: carmamagic
Reviews.Content: my second time in the hotel, loved it even more, the manager more than helpfull and all the crew super cute and super friendly, the decor of the hotel brings you to any lounge in miami beach, la or new york, lots of details. the rooms incredible and the bed is the best ever, soft cotton linens and really good pilows..lots of details in the room too.. the longe and bar rest are preatty much alive every night, and they have a movie night at the pool, very special pearl in san diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection”
Reviews.Author: kristensowell
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed with the Pearl for our 2 year wedding anniversary on a trip to San Diego. We could not have been more pleased. The hotel does great incentives and competitive rates,and has one of the most amazing restaurant bar in town!! Our room was retro sex, and we even had a pet fish for the week! (cute touch) we were so impressed with the personal touches from the hotel staff throughout our stay, and i can't think of anywhere else we would ever stay if we came back. The restaurant was super packed every night, and the do the cutest drive in movie night on wed night!! they also had an amazing 3 course prefix menu for $25 on monday nights that was out of this world!! Definatel take the time to try out some of their signature cocktails, they are fantastic and tasty!! We had a blast, and the staff really helped us to plan and enjoy our week in san diego! can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “First impressions can be deceiving...”
Reviews.Author: Statlerite
Reviews.Content: I had never been to the hotel before... so when I drove to the address with the help of my GPS I had to take a second look. The place looks so unassuming that is really easy to miss. Once we entered, we found ourselves in this funky bar space (closed on January 1, alas!), and after checking in at the tiny reception desk, we walked to our room (room 4). We loved the funky pool setting, and we thought the place will rock during warmer months. The room was simple, unpretentious in its decoration, but everything was well thought out, and very well fitted. I particularly loved the Artemide lamps and the cute details (Jaws was our room's pet fish). Our room had a terrace that was great to catch the early morning sun, but don't expect a lot of privacy from the hotel's neighbors). We had dinner at the Restaurant/bar by the pool the following evening, and food was top notch, some of the best I've had in San Diego.... however, the dessert menu was a slight dissappointment... oh well... Service was friendly and efficient... we stayed later for drinks at the bar, and it seems the place really gets busy with a locals scene during regular weekends (this was NYE weekend, and San Diego itself was pretty dead). Definitely a place to repeat in a city of many one-time only choices.

Reviews.Title: “Like a true pearl, you have to get inside first!”
Reviews.Author: barista516
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband after we got married in mid-December. It was the beginning of the week, Monday and Tuesday night, so obviously it wasn't too crowded. The man who checked us in was extremely helpful, comped us 2 drinks and our parking for our honeymoon :) They also moved us up to their biggest room since it was available - didn't think that happened much anymore! The restaurant was absolutely top-notch, we had dinner here both nights and were blown away by everything put in front of us. Parking is limited, and you are on a major road, but it's worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal For A Trendy Hotel if you don't mind the noise”
Reviews.Author: keets00
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary and watch the Chargers vs Eagles game. My frugal husband insisted we stay somewhere cheap but I was determined to bypass the standard price conscious accommodations such as holiday inn, etc. I found a great package for flights and accommodations at the Pearl. Overall we had a pretty good stay with a few minor complaints. The accommodations are very clean & trendy. You can see they pride they have in maintaining the hotel with the cute little additions (pet fish, daily quote sheet with menu specials, adopt a towel). It is true that the washrooms have minimal renos (faucets & lights) but they are clean. The staff is friendly. The food is delicious (we found a coupon on their website that gave us 2 for 1 dinner entrees if we purchased 2 drinks) however we had more than two since we were crawling distance to our room and our waitress let us know that they had some wines on special for $5/glass. And the location is fantastic. Biggest downfall is parking. We paid an additionally $10/day (which we figured would guarantee us a spot) however on Saturday night we didn't finding parking and were told they'd deduct the cost from our bill (but forgot to) and told to park across the street in the Medical clinic as they don't check on weekends. The only time we benefited from the parking pass was the first day when we wanted to offload our suitcases. I believe parking in the front is free (4-5 tiny stalls) but hotel parking on the side (4-5 stalls) is charged. You should be able to find street parking during the day or during the week. Parking Friday & Sat night is the biggest issues. The other issue we had was the paper thin walls. You can hear everything. I had issues sleeping one day because someone was chatting outside. I could hear them clear as day and when I commented (in a normal voice) to my husband they quieted down. Closing the windows helped a little. We live in the heart of downtown at home so the street traffic & airplane noise didnâ€™t bother us too much. Aside for these two issues we had a great stay and would likely come back.

Reviews.Title: “It's different”
Reviews.Author: misplaced
Reviews.Content: My husband and live in San Diego but we do not have a swimming pool so decided to go to a hotel in San Diego for 2 days to get away from the house and use the swimming pool. The Pearl has a salt water pool and so that is why I chose this hotel. We never did use the pool because it feels like your in a fish bowl. The hotel is U shaped with the pool in the center. The restaurant/bar is open and facing toward the pool and people sitting around the pool at the restaurant/bar seats and tables. No one was in the pool. We ate at the restaurant once. The food came beautifully prepared and delicious but the portions are quite small and pricey. The choice of items on the menu are not those of your everyday restaurants. The decor in the room is modern and selected to make good use of the tiny space (see my photos). Our room sat at the back on the second floor and seemed quiet enough and clean. There is not much room to hang or store your clothes and the shower stall is small. The bed was comfortable but felt a little bit short of a queen size. In the photo the bed looks really small because it is made-up from side to side and not from head to toe but you just move the pillows to sleep long way. We usually could find a place on the street to park but had to walk a couple of blocks which is not problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Retro and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KY1721
Reviews.Content: All the hotels I looked at prior to The Pearl where cookie cut hotels with the maple furniture and ugly bedspreads. I am not in any way high maintenance and normally I would accept that this is what we get for our desired price range but this was a special occasion and I was searching for something different. I stumbled across The Pearl and loved it based on the website, price and reviews I read. I knew this was dangerous but booked anyway for a single night of our five night trip just to check it out. I was hoping it was everything I thought it would be but really didnâ€™t expect it to be. Bottom line, this hotel was wonderful. It is a retro motel more than a luxury hotel but what it lacks in conveniences like room service and size it makes up in serious character and style. Furnishings are simple but stylish and the food was really great. It had a very comfortable atmosphere whether in the rooms or by the pool. We ended up booking for additional days because we enjoyed the hotel and location so much. I highly recommend you at least check out The Pearl!

Reviews.Title: “Funky Boutique Hotel...and that's a good thing”
Reviews.Author: tinymogul
Reviews.Content: If you're into fun, funky boutique hotels with a contemporary vibe then you'll dig The Pearl. We came because the wedding party had booked the place for out of town guests and were really glad they did. We're not the types who like the cookie-cutter, big chain hotels and we felt right at home. The complex is small and cozy, almost had a Melrose Place vibe. We checked in and sat down in the poolside restaurant for a cocktail and appetizer and watched a flick on the 'Dive-In' Movie Screen. Food was a bit pricey but the place was packed so it must be good. They don't have much parking and charge for the spaces they do have (I didn't much like paying to park but it was better than trying to find street parking).

Reviews.Title: “Super cute, great value, good location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGri5th
Reviews.Content: Check-in time was 3:00 pm and we showed up shortly after that. Our room was ready and waiting. Our hotel clerk assisted us efficiently and the staff (in the bar/restaurant) were extremely accomodating. The room was pretty basic-platform bed, lamp on one of the two nightstands, reading lap mounted on the wall about the bed, flat-screen TV (bonus for the hubby!), desk, two chairs, dresser. They provided a full-sized ironing board and iron and a full-sized hairdryer. Our room, like all the rooms, had a fish bowl with a Beta in it. Ours was named Betty. The bed was super comfy with high-thread count sheets, 4 pillows, plus two bolsters. Down comforter and a plush lap blanket. I had read mixed reviews about the noise level and was expecting to have to put up with loud music until late hours. I'm happy to report that noise was not an issue and our room was right across from the bar/restaurant. The pool was adorable and I wish we would have had the chance to take a dip. They had a games area where you could play Jenga, checkers, etc. They had an outside area for smoking with a pretty fountain. In addition to the ample on-street parking, for $10.00/day you could pay for a reserved space. We never had a problem finding a parking spot. My least favorite part of the stay was that my tub had a slow drain and there were some flying bugs in the room, which I discovered came from their homebase of the potted plant in the room. They never bothered me per se, but they were there. I'd totally stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Young, Hip, Unpretentious, Affordable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingPants
Reviews.Content: My partner & I (both women) stayed at this hotel, visiting for the weekend/week from Los Angeles. We had visited the Pearl about a year ago for a friend's birthday party to enjoy drinks and wanted to return to stay in one of the hotel rooms. Previously living in San Diego and knowing the price of an average hotel room, the rooms were a steal. The bed was comfortable, the television was the same one we have in our home in L.A., and we had a fish named Wolfgang for our roommate. The housekeeping was great...I requested a radio and he/she brought us this cool radio with programmed/ satellite channels, did a great job of cleaning the room, and left extra shampoo (by request). The manager (I think) was really nice as well...on Sunday afternoon he was about to close the bar but kept it open for 1-2 hours to serve my friends and I drinks. They have a really cute pool area with cabanas, and a large screen where movies were shown on one of the nights we were there. The only suggestions I have which would make this place a little better would be that the bathrooms are very basic and in need of some upgrading and the hotel is a little noisy. There is loud music playing during the afternoon and evening, which didn't really bother us (the music was good), but might bother other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyYack
Reviews.Content: The Pearl was a very fun and funky hotel in a great location. It's located not too far from downtown, with a location right near the water. The Hotel has a very retro feel. It's very clean and the staff was very friendly. Pros: Location was great. Rooms were very new and clean. Restaurant has GREAT food. Cons: The cons are not so much "cons", but FYIs. - If you purchase the "valet" parking, it's probably not worth it. They don't actually have true "reserved" parking and many times, you're left just parking on the street like everyone else. - The pool is nice, but it's actually part of the restaurant. So, unless all you do it work out and eat fish and vegetables, you may be hesitant to use it, since there's always an audience. - We stayed in room 20. This was nice because it overlooked the pool/courtyard, BUT since it's right above the restaurant, you MAY be woken up in the AM or be kept up at night because the Bass thumping. The beds in the rooms are low platform beds, so you can hear the bass more than if you were in a regular raised bed. We did ask for them to turn the music down and they did immediately, but it didn't completely remedy the issue. Other than those few things, we LOVED the Pearl and will probably consider staying there again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely priced boutique hotel with great bed and a goldfish.”
Reviews.Author: qsuzicue
Reviews.Content: The Pearl has modern decor but no attitude. We stayed one night, a Sunday, and though it's on a busy street, it was very quiet. The bed was super comfy (making us wish we had stayed more than one night). Willy the fish (a fishbowl with a goldfish is mounted above eye level on the wall by the window) was a nice touch. I didn't know about the $10 parking charge, but there's plenty of neighborhood parking. Also, this was a great way to avoid the downtown/Gaslamp district party scene and expensive parking. I also was concerned about possible airport noise, but there was none. I go to San Diego a lot and am looking forward to staying at The Pearl in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could move in!”
Reviews.Author: Leah_Emerald
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at The Pearl about 6 months prior to my "stay-cation"/bday celebration and spread the word amongst my friends. When the day finally arrived I was more than pleased with the service, surroundings & swanky vibe this little gem provided. I stated at time of check that "I never wanted to leave" and once check out took place, we ended up spending the rest of our day at The Pearl. My friends from across the country fell in love as well. We were all more than pleased with this wonderful spot. Dinner in the restaurant was DELICIOUS and the menu of offerings were perfection. The custom pearl cocktails were also a snazzy treat. Sunday brunch was the absolute BEST. We were on site from friday night to sunday morning and the hotel's personality, personability and service were beyond EXCELLENT. We will, without a doubt, return to The Pearl...either for a meal or another retreat. I already miss my stay and can't wait to make my way back.

Reviews.Title: “the pearl is a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: golddeer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while house hunting down in San Diego. The staff was super friendly, the design/decor was awesome, the pool was super fun, and the food was great. Lots of little touches (magazines and fresh water/towels at the pool; free WiFi; yummy H2O toiletries; cute artwork, etc) made it easy to relax and enjoy our stay. For $115 a night you really can't beat it! Especially if you are a foodie or design type. We also had a great meal and drinks too.

Reviews.Title: “We received awesome customer service.”
Reviews.Author: sdmich
Reviews.Content: Vanessa and York were great and one should request them when they get to the Pearl. They made sure we were taken care of and we had an amazing time. The food and drinks were fabulous and we will definitely swing by again for dinner or brunch by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The Pearl is my dream hotel.”
Reviews.Author: whatwouldjessedo
Reviews.Content: I rarely am able to give 100% glowing reviews of anything, so this is a rare occasion. I think The Pearl is my dream hotel because it really did provide everything I want in a hotel. First and foremost, the style and vibe of the place is amazing. When we arrived on a warm July Sunday around noon, there was a full-fledged pool party going on! Everyone was lounging around with drinks and listening to some great music poolside, some were finishing their brunch which is served every Sunday during the warm months. I didn't get a chance to join the fun that day, but I was jealous of those who did. It's an great example of mid-century googie architecture, but the owners have done an amazing job of renovating the place with one eye on maintaining it's vintage charm and the other eye on tasteful, hip modern design. I love the fact that they brought new life to this old hotel. There is a kidney bean shaped pool in the center courtyard and set next to it is an open-air full bar and restaurant. I think there are probably less than 20 rooms total at The Pearl which makes for a boutique feel. Despite the party in the courtyard, our room was quiet and a great place to relax. It was all brand new and styled like it should be featured in Dwell magazine. Wait, has this place been featured in Dwell? If not it should be. The room had a flat screen TV, lots of Ikea style furnishings, and a very comfortable bed. Oh, and it came with a goldfish named Cosmo! He swam around quietly in his bowl and was a great roommate. The location is great, very close to Downtown San Diego and the whole surrounding area, with restaurants all around. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The one issue is that you have to be careful about parking in the neighborhood. Apparently the police like giving tickets for the smallest parking infractions. However, the staff is very interested in helping that not be a problem for the guests, they will give you pointers and even spot for you while you park your car. So, not a problem really, just be careful parking your car. The The Pearl is my dream hotel because it has great prices, an amazing pool, clean, comfortable and stylish rooms, a welcoming staff, a full bar and restaurant, great and unique architecture and interior design, and it's in a perfect location. It has the look, feel and vibe I want in a hotel. I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for children!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nonaquilts
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter on a trip to San Diego. Hotwire booked us into this hotel. Hard to figure out where to park and where to check in. Went to our room and had to shut the blinds. Less than 20 feet across from us was as man in an apartment, staring into our room. When he saw us, he hid his curtains. Walked out of the room and got the wonderful view of a young woman, sun bathing in a thong and topless. Needless to say, I called Hotwire and was moved to a new hotel. Looks like a great place to party and drink but definately not a place for a family with children.

Reviews.Title: “Super-cute- retro,... and noisy at night, But would&will return”
Reviews.Author: trudi69
Reviews.Content: This place is super cute there is a lot of fun stuff in the room, i had two move, cause my rbathroom door wouldnt open. lol but they were so nice anf friendly and very helpful, Ashley at the desk is Super friendly and helpful, the staff is great i would recemend this hotel, and would return

Reviews.Title: “Great place, def recommend it”
Reviews.Author: JackSparrow22
Reviews.Content: OK, so yes, this place is noisy. There's no two-ways about the fact that the bar downstairs is really popular with the rich-folk of San Diego and they like to make enough noise for you to hear it clearly in one of the upstairs corner rooms. But hey, even if you don't drink and don't like to party, the spirit of the place gets to you. It's def young, hip and chic. (But if you just want a goodnight's rest, this place, esp on a weekend, is a no-no)... The rooms themselves were very clean, the bed very comfy. Nice plasma screen. If I have one small complaint, it's that the rooms were a little small--but the decor actually makes them feel cozy instead of cramped. I have to comment on the amenities since they were Bath & Body Works--yeah, they were quality Cocunut & Lime...smelled great! This was one of my favorite places in San Diego that we stayed, and I'd def go back to stay there, despite the noise. BTW, the bar closed at midnight or eleven on the night we were there, so it wasn't too bad...it was quiet enough after that to sleep in until 10am without any problems. PS--parking costs, but you can find street parking for free right by the hotel (not easy to find, but was safe once we got it)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Find”
Reviews.Author: debs020764
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. we found it, checked out the review and booked it. From check in to check out (and at all points inbetween) the staff couldnt have been more genuinely helpful or nice - owner, manager, bar staff, check in person etc. Plus the rooms were great, the scene around the bar and the pool a perfect mix between super relaxed and funky. and amazing food. Location good - easy to get everywhere. Not for kids or for adults seeking zen like peace and quiet, but perfect for adults wanting a getaway at somewhere where nobody cares if you're lying down in the bar on cushions reading the paper and drinking the free coffee. . We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and swank...and ALMOST there...”
Reviews.Author: kayemdee
Reviews.Content: The pictures make this place look great. The hotel totally had a hipster swanky vibe right off the bat and my boyfriend was very impressed when we got there. And so was I, until our third night there, when I notice that our sheets weren't changed. The bed wasn't even made, it seemed as though housekeeping just threw the blanket on without fixing the sheets underneath. I was very disturbed by that. I just hope that when we first arrived the sheets were freash and not from the previous guest. I read the reviews before we got there, and it seems as though I got the room with the leaky tub faucet that someone else mentioned. I thought the bathroom could have used more light. There were about 3 light switches for the bathroom area alone, but still it seemed very dark. The room itself is dark. But what you can do to brighten up the place, is take the bedside lamp and turn it upside down to face the ceiling. What I didn't really like about this place, even more then my unchanged sheets, was the bar scene. I didn't notice an over abundance of noisy or rowdiness. But I did notice a bunch of rude stares from the hipster locals when I went to talk to front desk one night. It was very uncomfortable as a hotel guest, but what are you going to do. What I liked very much about this place was that it was in a decent neighborhood. A lot of the reviews make it seem like its in some shady part of town, but indeed it is NOT. I have lived in shadier places, but this was nothing. There are no dark alleyways you'd have to park in. It was safe, we found street parking VERY EASILY. We did reserve parking one night, because we went out to a wedding and I wasn't sure what time we'd get back. They made the mistake of charging me for 2 nights, but were very quick to fix it and refund me. They also had these cool radios in the rooms that played specific stations. The Pearl's Station was very cool and my boyfriend and I would listen to it all the time and just chill in the room and relax. I wish I could have taken that home with me! They also offered complimentary wifi. I had no problems using it for my entire stay there. I encountered no issues and it was never slow. What I wished I could have done at the Pearl was to experience their dinning. I guess I'll have to save that for next time. Overall the hotel needs some work, but you get what you pay for. I would go there again, but maybe upgrade to the biggest room the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Hip with many serious misses - VERY NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDuo6
Reviews.Content: We travel a great deal and took a chance that the website was true but it turns out that all the reviews who complained about the noise are true. We thought "how bad can it be for one night?" Unless you are here to enjoy the very loud and rowdy pool/bar scene, this is NOT the place for you. The check in staff was nice, the room is small and hip but smelled odd like dirty carpet/musty. The bar is fun, better if you are not a hotel guest, and the happy hour is great. Deserts were not great and don't order an Irish Coffee unless you want a cup of coffee with whiskey poured in! The place was VERY noisy until midnight from the bar and because every room is on the street, the noise from Rosecrans is loud all night long. And, when we finally did fall asleep, we were awakened in the morning by very loud and noisy housekeeping staff talking and laughing outside our door. They do have parking for $10 per night and it is worth it as parking is impossible in the neighborhood. And, if you leave they will save your spot in the front lot for you. The best part about our stay was walking to Pomodoro's for dinner. It is a few blocks down and had wonderful service and GREAT italian food. So, our suggestion is to believe what everyone says about the noise and the smell in the rooms, find a different place to stay and have dinner at Pomodoro's!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great San Deigo Vibe”
Reviews.Author: funmum22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I found this hotel from the website and we could not have enjoyed our stay more! The Pearl is a gem! First of all i loved the way the name is written on the outside of the hotel. The place is small, but whomever was the designer was excellent at making every corner of space exude retro coolness. The room was standard size, but had a great bed, tv and radio. They all worked. The lounge, bar seemed really spacious due to the floor to ceiling windows which looked out at the pool. The pool was right outside the bar which had a movie screen above it and huge blowup transparent balls in it that floated around, cool. Was a little jet lagged so i took a nap, and then dinner. We got to the bar right before the end of happy hour, so we had a cocktail, made efficiently and tasty by the bartender. Noticed that many local people were at the restaurant, always a good sign. We ordered dinner, YUM! We appreciate a place that has a chef, i practically licked the plate, nice sauce. We ordered a $25 bottle of wine, also very yummy, and a great value. We received personal attention at every level of our experience here. Again, the bed was great. I had a restful night sleep. The morning coffee you guys, was fabulous!! Nothing says good morning like a nice cup of java. ahh. I would stay here again, and look forward to it! Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Definintely Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: yelabgirl
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay here because I used to live in Point Loma and was happy to see someone had updated this hotel into what looked like a chic, modern little gem. Unfortunately it did not come close to meeting my expectations. When we checked in and got to our room - there was basically some sort of plumbing issue that had completely backed up into our sink. Yuk! - we called the front desk and they promptly came to clean it up. But that wasn't the end of it. We were promised by the website a large flat screen TV. - true, but it didn't really work. Each time I turned it on, it would immediately turn back off. I finally figured out that if I turned it on and immediately changed the channel it would stay on. But then when I turned it off, it turned itself back on. Bizarre. We were also promised wi-fi, which again - DID NOT WORK! Neither did the in-room radio system. sigh. The room was quite small and while they had tried to update the look - the remodel was done on the cheap! The rain style showers drizzled water that was either burning hot or ice cold - and again, hard to turn off and on as the nozzle turned endlessly in either direction. The room layout was OK but it was very dark and dank. And while the room was supposed to have a king size platform bed - they obviously went cheap and bought some sort of irregular sized mattress for a big discount. The platform itself was king sized, but the mattress ended more than a foot before the end of the platform. Turns out it was only 6 feet long - MUCH shorter than a King and my poor boyfriend spent the night with his feet hanging off the end! Oh yeah, and there is basically no parking available. When we complained, the staff was quite rude and unhelpful to us. The service was definitely amateurish. We didn't have any food or drinks - so if you are looking for a bar - this might be a good place to go as the bar was busy at night. BUT DO NOT STAY HERE - there are plenty of nice hotels on Shelter Island and Harbor Island, don't waste your money in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful minimalistic design, poorly finished bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: a_na_na_ba
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about the price of this hotel; here I was getting the opportunity to stay in a 3-4 star hotel for the price of a 2 star hotel over a weekend in winter (winter in Southern California is like my Washington's summer).
